title: Russian Loanwords in English
description: From cosmonaut to mammoth, discover the fascinating Russian words that have entered the English language!

questions.question: The word 'cosmonaut' comes from Russian. What does the 'kosmo' part mean?

Which English word for a type of frozen Arctic landscape comes from the Russian adaptation of a Sami word?
The word 'mammoth' entered English from Russian. The Russian 'mamont' likely came from which language?
Which word for a Russian country house or cottage is used in English?
The word 'vodka' is a Russian diminutive. What is it a diminutive of?
Which English word for a set of nested dolls comes from the Russian name 'Matryona'?
The word 'sputnik' was famously used for the first artificial satellite. What does 'sputnik' literally mean in Russian?
Which word for a three-horse-drawn vehicle or a group of three comes from Russian?
The word 'intelligentsia' was borrowed from Russian. What does it refer to?
options: The educated and intellectual elite of society
